newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian money market trade brisk, demand strong.
newsitem.headline: Croatian money market trade brisk, demand strong.

text.p: Croatian money market trade was brisker on Wednesday but rates were steady despite high demand for kuna funds, dealers said.
"The banks' accounts were drained on Tuesday due to monthly wage payments," a dealer told Reuters.
She said strong demand for kuna funds could not be met by the funds on offer because of poor liquidity.
Fresh borrowings totalled 47.5 million kuna, most of them call money loans granted at an unchanged 10.5 percent.
One 30-day interbank loan was struck at a flat 15-percent rate and one 10-day borrowing was made at 11.5 percent.

Tuesday's overnight trade totalled 65.4 million kuna sought by three banks to cover their shortfalls and another two to maintain their mandatory reserves. -- Sandra Kalogjera, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
